page.title: 05HARDWICK VILLAGE
page.content: {Hardwick}is a hamlet some three miles north - west of Wellingborough. Its population in the last census was 57 people, most of whom were between the ages of 16 - 65. The main buildings today are the church, Manor House and the old School (now a private house). The village has seen the population rise and fall since 1801 when it had 68 people. Its peak came in 1881 with 125 people and from a similar population in 1931 it has tended to fall to its present number of 50 - 60 people. The village has boasted a wheelwright (1874) and two shops (1931). Today there is no school, pub or shops. The village is Z shaped with most of the housing on an L shaped through road. Most of the houses are privately owned. Because if its isolation most people own cars.
